sector_narrative: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
description_narrative: Funding under this investment provides humanitarian support in Chad for the United Nations Mine Action Service Mine Action Unit (MAU), which is within the United Nations Mission in Central African Republic and Chad (MINURCAT). The main goal of the project is to reduce the number of civilians and vulnerable populations being killed and injured as a result of Chadâ€™s explosives remnants of war (ERW) contamination, through a comprehensive Mine Risk Education (MRE) programme. The objectives are: (1) Raise awareness and increase the knowledge concerning the dangers of ERW in local communities within eastern Chad including: a) organising and supporting MRE activities in local communities; b) developing appropriate visual materials targeting the non-literate local populations, refugees and internally displaced people; c) production of documents for distribution through community leaders; and d) Intergrating and deploying mobile MRE teams to areas that have had ERW emergencies, as a first inter
